title: Linux hexdump Command with Practical Examples
description: Explore the Linux hexdump command, a powerful tool for viewing and manipulating binary data. Learn how to use hexdump to analyze file contents, customize output, and gain insights into data structures.

meta.title: Linux hexdump Command with Practical Examples
meta.description: Explore the Linux hexdump command, a powerful tool for viewing and manipulating binary data. Learn how to use hexdump to analyze file contents, customize output, and gain insights into data structures.
meta.keywords: hexdump, binary data, file analysis, data manipulation, Linux utilities

verify.name: Verify hexdump command usage
verify.hint: Make sure the hexdump command is installed and you can run it on the example.txt file in the ~/project directory.

verify.name: Verify hexdump command usage on binary file
verify.hint: Make sure the hexdump command is installed and you can run it on the binary_file.bin file in the ~/project directory, including using the -n option to view a specific number of bytes.

verify.name: Verify hexdump command customization
verify.hint: Make sure the hexdump command is installed and you can run it with the -v, -x, and -d options on the binary_file.bin file in the ~/project directory.
